Hotel Supervisor Job at Zamiva Transnational Services




        
    

        
        Zamiva Transnational Services is a full-fledged human capital development and management consultancy servicing company incorporated in August, 2021 with its corporate Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to ensuring quality value addition to our clients’ businesses spanning all sectors of the economy in the areas of HR consulting, outsourcing, talent acquisition, executive search, employee/reference background verification, payroll management, learning & development, renting, catering and janitorial services, etc., leveraging research, technology, a highly skilled and passionate human capital base, and our core values of Collaboration, Leadership, Integrity, Continuous Improvement, High Performance and Expertise.
     

            
    



We are seasoned human resources professionals and management strategists with enviable corporate exposure and experience spanning various sectors of the economy, including banking, logistics & courier, engineering, manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, food & beverages, oil & gas, telecommunication, private security services, hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Supervisor
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Two days on duty,two days off duty

Responsibility


	To provide supervisory services in a Lounge / Bar / Hotel 


Requirements


	OND/HND in any discipline
	5 years of experience as a waiter/waitresses
	Candidates should reside around Surulere, Ijesha Cele, Mile 2, Ajegunle, Apapa Festac Town and Abule/Ado Barrack, Volks, Igando, Iyana-Oba, Ikotun, Oshodi and any part of Lagos State or even any part of the country because of accommodation and feeding.


Salary
N70,000 per month. 

Benefits:


	Accommodation will be provided,
	Feeding will be provided two times in a d


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: transnationalzamiva21@yahoo.com or metusmetus73@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact 09060194404.

DevOps / Azure / Networking Engineer Job at Swift Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Swift Consulting Limited - Our client, an Education, Human Resources and Management firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps / Azure / Networking Engineer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	They are currently seeking qualified and experienced applicants to fill the role of DevOps / Azure / Networking Engineer for one of our clients in the IT industry.


Major Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain and optimise cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure.
	Monitor and troubleshoot network performance and connectivity issues.
	Design, implement, and manage scalable DevOps pipelines and CI/CD workflows.
	Automate deployment, monitoring, and system configurations using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
	Ensure high availability, scalability, and security across systems and services.
	Collaborate with development and operations teams to support application lifecycle management.
	Maintain documentation of systems, processes, and configurations.
	Implement best practices in DevOps, cloud computing, and networking.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	Proven experience in DevOps engineering and Azure cloud services.
	Proficiency in scripting languages like PowerShell, Bash, or Python.
	Experience with version control tools like Git.
	Strong knowledge of Azure resources (VMs, Azure DevOps, AKS, App Services, Azure Storage, etc.).
	Solid experience with networking concepts (TCP/IP, DNS, firewalls, load balancers, VPNs).
	Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and configuration management.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hireme@swiftconsulting.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	Control and report on project budgets, timelines, and resource utilization.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering, Project Management, or a related field (Master&rsquo;s Degree is a plus).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience managing oil and gas projects.
	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
	PMP, PRINCE2, or other project management certification is required.
	Strong understanding of oil and gas industry standards, practices, and regulations.
	Proven track record of successful project delivery.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
	Applicants must be flexible to travel from time to time.


Salary
